hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In ${\maroonD{{?}}} = \purpleC{40} \div \greenD{5}$, the $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{40}$.

The $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{5}$.

![Tape diagram showing 40 is equal to 5 equal groups of question mark](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a954b44b408acc05843cdce1de785686f00694d5)

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{?}}$.

Gia can use these multiplication equations:

- $\purpleC{40} = \greenD{{5}} \times \maroonD{{?}}$
- $\purpleC{40} = \maroonD{{?}} \times \greenD{{5}}$

question.content:
Gia wants to use multiplication to solve ${?} = 40 \div 5$.

**Which two multiplication equations can Gia use?**
